headline: U.S. strikes on Iran will likely boost defense stocks. Here’s what will keep the cash flowing even after the conflict ends.
summary: A massive backlog of maintenance and software contracts will ensure recurring revenue.

headline: What Defense Stocks Stand to Gain—and Lose—From the U.S. Attacks on Iran
summary: The U.S. attack on Iran promises to increase already-high geopolitical tensions, which have prompted countries around the world to raise spending on national defense.  The attacks followed a weekslong military buildup in the region and came after an American strike on Iran’s nuclear facilities in June.  Through Friday trading, the  was up 35% since the June Iran strike.
